page.title: 09THE EILDON HILLS
page.content: The Eildons were formed millions of years ago by continuous volcanic activity,later they themselves became volcanoes.There heights are{1327}feet for the Eildon Hill North,{1385}feet for the Eildon Mid Hill and{1216}for the Eildon Wester Hill. From the top of the Eildon Mid Hill you can see the Cheviots in England,Sutra Hill in Edinburgh and the Pinal Huegh Monument on Monteviot Estate. On the top of Eildon Hill North there is an old roman hill fort and a signal station.Around the old fort there are the remains of of a wall which was built to protect the fort,it is now covered with grass and moss etc.
